abstract: Resolution, the acquisition vehicle founded by Clive Cowdery, announced Monday that it’s in talks to buy some of the U.K. operations of French insurance giant Axa in a $4 billion deal, MarketWatch reported.
snippet: Resolution, the acquisition vehicle founded by Clive Cowdery, announced Monday that it’s in talks to buy some of the U.K. operations of French insurance giant Axa in a $4 billion deal, MarketWatch reported.
lead_paragraph: Resolution, the acquisition vehicle founded by Clive Cowdery, announced Monday that it’s in talks to buy some of the British operations of French insurance giant Axa in a £2.75 billion ($4 billion) deal, MarketWatch reported.

headline.main: Resolution Eyes $4 Billion Deal for Axa Units
